alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 27 at 1:56AM MDT until March 27 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 7 PM MDT TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong west to northwest winds will combine with low humidities this afternoon to produce several hours of critical fire weather conditions over northeast and east central New Mexico. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and East Central Plains (Zone 126) from 1 pm to 7 pm MDT Monday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts to near 45 or 50 mph. Winds becoming northwest to north late in the afternoon over the Northeast Plains. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from about 9 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
